topic.title: Icons
topic.shortdesc: DITA Bootstrap includes the Bootstrap Icons set by default. Other Icon libraries such as can be added or removed using command line parameters.

section.title: Bootstrap Icons
section.p: Bootstrap Icons is a growing library of SVG icons that are designed by @mdo and maintained by the Bootstrap Team. They are open source and licensed under MIT, just like Bootstrap so the icon set is freely available to everyone.

section.title: Installing icons
section.p: A Link to the default Bootstrap Icons CDN set is included by default. If you do not need any icons you can exclude them by setting the --icons.include=no

Other icon sets such as Font Awesome Feather and Octicons are available. To use an alternative set of icons, modify the sample header or specify the path of the Icons CDN file using the --icons.cdn.path parameter.

section.title: Example
section.p: Icon fonts with classes for every icon are included in Bootstrap Icons. Include the icon web fonts in your page via CSS, then reference the class names as needed in your DITA (e.g., i outputclass="bi-alarm"/).
Use an additional otherprops and alter the CSS font-size and color to change the icon appearance.
